channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-6575] LangScript.floattypes gets REAL instead of expected DOUBLE
item.description:
Tinderbox test of trunk:

http://download.java.net/javadesktop/derby/request_5590862/javadb-task-3858021.html

    junit.framework.ComparisonFailure: Output at line 1633 expected:<[F                                                                                                                               |DOUBLE]         > but was:<[R                                                                                                                               |REAL  ]         >
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.util.CanonTestCase.compareCanon(CanonTestCase.java:110)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.util.ScriptTestCase.runTest(ScriptTestCase.java:203)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase.runBare(BaseTestCase.java:118)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase.runBareOverridable(BaseJDBCTestCase.java:440)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase.runBare(BaseJDBCTestCase.java:457)
	at junit.extensions.TestDecorator.basicRun(TestDecorator.java:24)
	at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:21)
	at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)
	at org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestSetup.run(BaseTestSetup.java:57)
item.summary: LangScript.floattypes gets REAL instead of expected DOUBLE

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The test expects this output:

ij> select columnname, columndatatype 
from sys.syscolumns c, sys.systables t
where c.referenceid = t.tableid and CAST(t.tablename AS VARCHAR(128)) ='T';
COLUMNNAME                                                                                                                      |COLUMNDATATYPE 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
D                                                                                                                               |DOUBLE         
F                                                                                                                               |DOUBLE         
F1                                                                                                                              |REAL           
F23                                                                                                                             |REAL           
F24                                                                                                                             |DOUBLE         
F53                                                                                                                             |DOUBLE         
R                                                                                                                               |REAL

In the failed test run, it got this:

ij> select columnname, columndatatype 
from sys.syscolumns c, sys.systables t
where c.referenceid = t.tableid and CAST(t.tablename AS VARCHAR(128)) ='T';
COLUMNNAME                                                                                                                      |COLUMNDATATYPE 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
D                                                                                                                               |DOUBLE         
R                                                                                                                               |REAL           
F                                                                                                                               |DOUBLE         
F1                                                                                                                              |REAL           
F23                                                                                                                             |REAL           
F24                                                                                                                             |DOUBLE         
F53                                                                                                                             |DOUBLE

Looks like the order of the rows is the only difference, so adding an ORDER BY clause to the query would probably fix the test.
The attached patch orderby.diff adds an ORDER BY clause to the problematic query.

Commit 1594196 from Knut Anders Hatlen in branch 'code/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1594196 ]

DERBY-6575: LangScript.floattypes gets REAL instead of expected DOUBLE

Add ORDER BY to query to make the results stable.

review of list of issues fixed in 10.11 but not in 10.10 for possible compatibility issues in upcoming release.

This change is test only, so not an issue. Looks to me like it could be backported if anyone is interested.
